content.title: Building Scalable Knowledge Sharing Platforms with Spring Boot and React
content.contentHtml:
Introduction
In today's rapidly evolving tech landscape, the ability to share knowledge efficiently has become paramount. Whether you're documenting a complex debugging session or explaining architectural decisions, a well-designed platform can make the difference between information being lost or leveraged.
This article explores how to build a modern knowledge sharing platform using Spring Boot 3, React 18, and MySQL, with AI-powered features to enhance the authoring experience.
The Architecture
Our platform follows a layered architecture:
ΓÇó Presentation Layer: React with functional components and hooks
ΓÇó Business Layer: Spring Boot services with transactional boundaries
ΓÇó Data Layer: JPA/Hibernate with MySQL for relational data
The separation allows independent scaling and testing of each component.
Key Technical Decisions
Why Spring Boot over Node.js?
While Node.js offers rapid prototyping, Spring Boot provides:
Type safety with Java 17
Robust transaction management
Excellent ORM support with JPA
Enterprise-grade security features
Database Design
We use MySQL with proper indexing on:
Foreign keys for join performance
Search fields (title, content) for full-text queries
Slug fields for URL lookups
AI Integration Strategy
Rather than bolting on AI as an afterthought, we integrated it deeply:
Writing Assistant: Expands bullet points into prose using Gemini API
Tag Suggestions: Analyzes content to recommend relevant tags
Smart Search: Semantic understanding of query intent
All AI calls proxy through our backend to protect API keys and implement retry logic.
Challenges & Solutions
Challenge: Rich text editor theming in dark mode
Solution: Custom CSS overrides for CKEditor to match our slate/amber design system
Challenge: Handling JWT refresh tokens securely
Solution: HttpOnly cookies for refresh tokens, short-lived access tokens in memory
Conclusion
Building a knowledge platform is as much about user experience as it is about code. By combining Spring Boot's reliability with React's interactivity and AI's assistance, we've created a tool that makes sharing technical knowledge feel effortless.
The complete source code is available on GitHub - links in my profile.
